Card.Gloss: at the same time; together with (dat)
untranslatable particle - makes a statement contingent
to lead up; to put to sea, set sail (middle)
to take up; to kill, put to death
to have received; to be distant
to give back, pay; to sell (middle)
himself, herself, itself, same; he, she, it
as far as, up to (gen); until (as conjunction)
to come to know, learn, know, realize
to go or come in or into, enter
on account of, for the sake of (gen)
over, on, at the time of (gen); on the basis of, at (dat); on, to, against (acc)
to call, name; to invoke, appeal to (middle)
to visit, have a care for
to bring good news, preach good tidings
good news, glad tidings, the Gospel
to think it good, be well pleased with
to be chief; to think, regard, consider
to set, constitute, put in charge
down from, against (gen); according to, during, throughout (acc)
to lie down, lie sick, recline (at meals)
remaining, the rest (as a noun); for the rest, henceforth (as an adverb)
on the one hand, indeed (postpositive particle often untranslated)
interrogative particle in questions expecting a negative answer
to entertain (a stranger); to startle, bewilder
strange; a stranger, host (as a noun)
as great as, as many as
and not, not even, neither, nor
from (gen); beside, in the presence of (dat); alongside of (acc)
to be present; to have arrived
to pass by, pass away; to arrive
at some time, once, ever, formerly
to attend to, give heed to
at all, somehow, in any way
kindred; a relative, kinsman (as a noun)
to bring together; it is profitable
to commend (transitive); to stand with, consist (intransitive)
someone, something, a certain one, a certain thing, anyone, anything
so great, so much; so many (plural)
a guard, a prison, a watch
to eat to the full, be satisfied, be filled
to make room for; to hold
as, that, like, how, about, now
